known_senses.definition: A tool, originally made from a feather but now usually a small tubular instrument, containing ink used to write or make marks.
Marks of ink left by a pen.
known_senses.known_usages: He's unhappy because he got {pen} on his new shirt.

known_senses.definition: An enclosure (enclosed area) used to contain domesticated animals, especially sheep or cattle.
known_usages: There are two steers in the third {pen}.

known_senses.definition: A penitentiary, i.e. a state or federal prison for convicted felons.
known_usages: They caught him with a stolen horse, and he wound up in the {pen} again.

unknown_usage_examples.usage: After putting the cows back into their pen, the farmer worked on repairing the part of the fence they had broken through.
